title: Students Reach New Heights With Spaceport Nova Scotia First Launch
summary: The first launch of Canada's new spaceport is in the record books. Today a group of young Canadian STEM enthusiasts from the Arbalest Rocketry team, hailing from York University in Ontario, successfully launched their amateur high-powered rocket, named 'Goose 3,' from Spaceport Nova Scotia.

title: Europe leans on SpaceX to bridge launcher gap
summary: Europe, temporarily lacking its own access to space, plans to rely more on SpaceX to launch key science and navigation spacecraft while working to restore its launch capabilities.

title: Viasat signs deal to commercialize European airspace tracking service
summary: A group founded by European air traffic controllers has signed a deal to bring improved airspace-tracking capabilities from Viasat’s constellation to market next year.

title: China’s Landspace set for second methalox rocket launch
summary: Chinese commercial launch firm Landspace is set for a second attempt to reach orbit with its Zhuque-2 rocket July 12.

title: Space Command argues for shift from static to dynamic satellite operations
summary: In order to better keep tabs on adversaries, the U.S. military needs satellites that can actively maneuver in orbit, the deputy commander of U.S. Space Command said July 6.

title: California Science Center GO For Shuttle Endeavour Stacking
summary: The iconic space shuttle Endeavour is set to embark on its final journey to its permanent home at a new building in Los Angeles.

title: SpaceX focuses on launch site readiness ahead of Starship Flight 2
summary: Progress toward the second flight of the world’s most powerful launch vehicle continues to take place at Starbase. With Ship 25 passing its six-engine Static Fire test, the focus has returned to completing upgrades to the Orbital Launch Mount (OLM), with the installation of a steel plate water deluge system now taking place.

title: Ariane V goes out in style, retires after 27 years of service

title: SpaceX completes 28th commercial resupply mission to ISS
summary: After undocking from the International Space Station on June 29th, SpaceX’s Cargo Dragon capsule splashed down off of the coast of Jacksonville,...

title: ESA Launch Independent Enquiry Commission to Investigate Vega C Z40 Test Failure
summary:
ESA has established an Independent Enquiry Commission to investigate the failure of the Avio-led Vega C Zefiro 40 (Z40) static fire test. “An Independent Enquiry Commission has been established by ESA Director General Josef Aschbacher to investigate the recent results of the static firing test of the Vega-C Zefiro 40 motor, which took place on […]
The post ESA Launch Independent Enquiry Commission to Investigate Vega C Z40 Test Failure appeared first on European Spaceflight.
